s.text: The main computer failed again Sept. 8, but the replacement crew reported that the situation was "normal."
Two days later, President Kennedy met with advisers and asked, "Is there any place we can catch them?"
Introducing the Salyut 1 space station (a "salute" to Gagarin), the Soviets began a focus on long-term, orbital space living that endures today.
Introducing the Salyut 1 space station (a "salute" to Gagarin), the Soviets began a focus on long-term, orbital space living that endures today.
Introducing the Salyut 1 space station (a "salute" to Gagarin), the Soviets began a focus on long-term, orbital space living that endures today.
Introducing the Salyut 1 space station (a "salute" to Gagarin), the Soviets began a focus on long-term, orbital space living that endures today.
Three weeks before this announcement, the United States had launched its first manned flight: a 15-minute journey by Alan Shepard that didn't even reach orbit.
Sputnik was launched on Oct. 4, 1957--the first man-made object to orbit Earth.
By 1963, when John Glenn orbited Earth three times in five hours, the Soviet Union was launching daylong flights and a 48-orbit mission.
Three weeks before this announcement, the United States had launched its first manned flight: a 15-minute journey by Alan Shepard that didn't even reach orbit.
Sputnik was launched on Oct. 4, 1957--the first man-made object to orbit Earth.
By 1963, when John Glenn orbited Earth three times in five hours, the Soviet Union was launching daylong flights and a 48-orbit mission.
Three weeks before this announcement, the United States had launched its first manned flight: a 15-minute journey by Alan Shepard that didn't even reach orbit.
Sputnik was launched on Oct. 4, 1957--the first man-made object to orbit Earth.
By 1963, when John Glenn orbited Earth three times in five hours, the Soviet Union was launching daylong flights and a 48-orbit mission.

Soyuz 11 blew a hatch on re-entry, killing three cosmonauts, but after this early catastrophe the Soviet program boasted constant space habitation and scientific experimentation for more than two decades.
